metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33829 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the HTML Data Processor in CKEditor 4 4.14.0 through 4.16.x before 4.16.1 allows remote attackers to inject executable JavaScript code through a crafted comment because --!> is mishandled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-33829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.16.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.16.0+dfsg-2').
